abstract: The four largest commercial banks in the United States could face as much as $42 billion in losses if they are forced to repurchase troubled mortgages from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, according to Fitch Ratings.
snippet: The four largest commercial banks in the United States could face as much as $42 billion in losses if they are forced to repurchase troubled mortgages from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, according to Fitch Ratings.
lead_paragraph: The four largest commercial banks in the United States could face as much as $42 billion in losses if they are forced to repurchase troubled mortgages from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, according to Fitch Ratings, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Huge Mortgage Bill Seen for 4 Big Banks
